alert.note: Alert for Hidalgo (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 21 at 4:30PM CDT until April 21 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN HIDALGO COUNTY... At 429 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Mcallen Police Department, or over South McAllen, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public. At 420 PM CDT 2 inch hail was reported Penitas. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Mission, Pharr, San Juan, Alamo, Donna, Hidalgo, Progreso, Palmview, Penitas and Palmhurst. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
